Come on Katarina actually takes skill with the current meta she literally gets shitted on with all the juggernauts, tanks, and ad assassin's like Talon and Rengar.

Frankly you have a lot of kit that is REALLY good and will be good forever or if they decide to rework her. 
You don't have mana. 
You scale with AP and AD, so get AP items of course
You have a flash in your kit
Your Q can be used for farming and even for poking at the enemy laner through the minion wave
and a passive that resets your Q,W,and E and decreases the CD on your R by 15 secs upon kill. 

Granted that she isn't nearly as broken and annoying as she used to be, these are just things about her kit that just make her good no matter what. If you get counter picked then play safe and farm under tower as much as you can and see if you can sneak to bot or top for a kill or two, at that point you are ahead.

KIT =/= state of balance.
Kata beginners do have a 40% winrate - experienced Kata players have a 54% winrate. That means there is a 14% winrate difference between unexperienced and experienced summoners.
That's actually really huge and proves that Kata is definetely not an easy faceroll champion.

I'm not saying that kit is the only thing that equals a state of balance, but a champions kit is EXTREMELY important in determining their power and effectiveness in their role. If anything, I feel that this 14% gap in winrates PROVES what I just said, because while Katarina has a great kit, the most difficult part of her is USING the kit effectively, and less experienced players have a 40% winrate, which isn't that bad, and more experienced players have a 54% winrate. Now I'm not pointing fingers but I do recall hearing a lot of people complain about Thresh because his winrate is above 50%. I'm not saying that Katarina is OP, but I think it's a little much to say that she is under-powered. 

Also, look back at my original comment. No where did I say that she was an easy faceroll champion. I was merely pointing out that she has a lot of utility to her kit that makes her playable in almost any setting if you can use her right
